TopicTitle: SpaceX to reveal their manned DragonV2 capsule tonight

Articles.Content:
http://www.spacex.com/webcast/

Going on livestream in just under six and a half hours as of the writing of this post. I'll be fast asleep when it happens. Watch it for me, will you?
Yeah, already looking forward to that. However it'll be 4am in Germany at that time, haven't decided yet whether I stay up late or stand up early .

FUUU

i'm in france, it'll be too late to watch it.

Will i be able to watch it later?
I foresee the end of the cst-100 and dreamchaser.
I'm sure a youtube version will be up not long after.

BTW they did already post a teaser picture on twitter: http://t.co/AcMz0aRV0Z

Looks comfortable. /me wants to ride it

And another one: https://twitter.com/SpaceX/status/472103888137375745

Now compare this to the Soyuz control panel: https://twitter.com/SimoRoth/status/471746563903995905

I suppose this is what a few decades of tech base difference looks like
I hope it comes with a proper handbook, not like Orion with its digitalised version.

And another one: https://twitter.com/SpaceX/status/472103888137375745

Now compare this to the Soyuz control panel: https://twitter.com/SimoRoth/status/471746563903995905

I suppose this is what a few decades of tech base difference looks like

Prefer the soyuz for some reason, despite being in russian
This will be the Lamborghini of space. Maybe they will put up a virtual walk through?
Reputation points for the one that makes the first (or the better) KSP replica of it!!
Too bad I live in Europe
Honestly I'm not entirely surprised at the simplicity of the control panel, its designed to be compatible with crew that possess extraordinarily basic training.

BTW they did already post a teaser picture on twitter: http://t.co/AcMz0aRV0Z

Looks comfortable. /me wants to ride it

Sure got a couple of million? ?

It'll be midday here in Australia, I can con my teacher into watching it in class.

Actually since the things we seeing are things like power overrides, emergency alarms, chutes ect, I wouldn't be surprised if the manual switches where more for SHTF moments where you need to hit critical systems with-ought taking the 4 seconds to use the menus. I wonder if they will be trying to use touch screens as I see that being difficult with the suit gloves...

I wouldn't ride a rocket with touchscreen controls.

I wouldn't ride a rocket with touchscreen controls.

Haha neither would but, but Im sure they have normal controls. I meant with the displays for information.

Livestream starting in 10 minutes!

http://www.spacex.com/webcast/
The real question, does it have a toilet.

The real question, does it have a toilet.

Nope, they have to go outside.
Is anyone getting a feed yet or just the SpaceX marque?

Nope, they have to go outside.

Well diaper's it is then, ill stick with the soyuz, has a toilet.
Good to know im not tbe only one regex. It seems the chat has gone down. Can you verify?
For those asking, we on YouTube are still waiting around staring at the screen saver.
